titles.title: Small Business Investment Capital Company Act of 2015
Small Business Investment Capital Company Act of 2015
A bill to amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to provide for increased limitations on leverage for multiple licenses under common control.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

calendar.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Reported by Senator Vitter with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 104.

bill.summary:
6/10/2015--Reported to Senate amended. Small Business Investment Company Capital Act of 2015
(Sec. 2) Amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase from $225 million to $350 million the maximum amount of outstanding leverage to be made available by the Small Business Administration to two or more commonly controlled small business investment companies not under capital impairment.
